alert.note: Alert for Geauga (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 01 at 6:17PM EDT until June 01 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Ohio, including the following counties, Geauga, Portage and Trumbull. * WHEN...Until 930 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 616 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Multiple rounds of thunderstorms are expected. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Warren, Cortland, Newton Falls, Garrettsville, Kinsman, North Bloomfield, West Farmington, Bristolville, Leavittsburg, Vienna Center, Parkman, Vienna, Mecca, Windham, Johnston, Hiram, Orangeville, Yankee Lake, Champion Heights and Howland Center. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
